0337ad59-e3cf-47cb-9172-b9e70cbaff96.description: Earners of the Asset Management Foundations badge have an understanding of the key concepts, principles and processes of asset management. They understand the principles and terminology of asset management as set out in the ISO55000 standards and they can identify and explain the key success factors and considerations for good asset management practice.
0337ad59-e3cf-47cb-9172-b9e70cbaff96.name: Asset Management Foundations

issuer.summary: issued by Institute of Public Works Engineering Australasia (IPWEA)

entity.name: Institute of Public Works Engineering Australasia (IPWEA)

alignments.name: ISO55000
alignments.description: ISO 55000:2014 provides an overview of asset management, its principles and terminology, and the expected benefits from adopting asset management.

alignments.name: International Infrastructure Management Manual (IIMM)
alignments.description: The International Infrastructure Management Manual (IIMM) has been driven largely by the updates to the ISO 55000 Asset Management Standards. The Manual provides valuable learnings for those who have a vital stewardship role in managing the investment in infrastructure on behalf of their community, customers or investors.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the formal learning requirements of the course to a satisfactory level.
Successfully complete all assessment items to the required standard.
Earning the Asset Management Foundations credential.

65a89dae-78af-40f6-8be8-b7ba8312fac1.description: Earners of the IPWEA NAMS Canada Professional Certificate in Asset Management Planning have a comprehensive understanding of asset management planning. They are able to select, collate, edit and report on asset management data, and develop a comprehensive Asset Management Plan (one asset class). They can communicate the impacts of levels of service and risk associated with a planned budget and long-term financial plan, and develop demand management options and priorities for capital works.
65a89dae-78af-40f6-8be8-b7ba8312fac1.name: IPWEA NAMS Canada Professional Certificate in Asset Management Planning

issuer.summary: issued by Institute of Public Works Engineering Australasia (IPWEA)

entity.name: Institute of Public Works Engineering Australasia (IPWEA)

alignments.name: ISO 55000
alignments.description: ISO 55000:2014 provides an overview of asset management, its principles and terminology, and the expected benefits from adopting asset management.

alignments.name: International Infrastructure Management Manual (IIMM)
alignments.description: The International Infrastructure Management Manual (IIMM) has been driven largely by the updates to the ISO 55000 Asset Management Standards. The Manual provides valuable learnings for those who have a vital stewardship role in managing the investment in infrastructure on behalf of their community, customers or investors.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the formal requirements of the course to a satisfactory level.
Successfully completed a formal assessment involving the development of an Asset Management Plan.
Earning the Professional Certificate in Asset Management Planning.
This initiative is offered through the Municipal Asset Management Program, which is delivered by the Federation of Canadian Municipalities and funded by the Government of Canada.

289c0cc0-5604-41ff-9d04-432e0c2b46ad.description: Earners of the Fleet Management Certificate have a comprehensive understanding of the key principles and concepts of plant and vehicle fleet management. They are able to execute core processes and tasks in the key areas of utilisation, financial management, procurement, maintenance management, service level agreements and regulatory requirements. They understand and can contribute to the implementation of specific Acts, Regulations and Code of Practice.
289c0cc0-5604-41ff-9d04-432e0c2b46ad.name: Fleet Management Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Institute of Public Works Engineering Australasia (IPWEA)

entity.name: Institute of Public Works Engineering Australasia (IPWEA)

alignments.name: Plant and Vehicle Management Manual (PVMM)
alignments.description: Australia’s most comprehensive guide for fleet managers. First developed by IPWEA in 2004, the manual has been substantially revised to address current issues regarding the fleet industry.

alignments.name: Plant and Vehicle Maintenance Safe Practice Guide
alignments.description: Developed with input from practicing Fleet Managers, the Safe Practice Guide provides a practical approach to mechanical workshop and mechanical maintenance health and safety.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the formal requirements of the course to a satisfactory level.
Successfully complete the formal assessment components of the course.
Earning the IPWEA Fleet Management Certificate.

07efbd6c-23e4-4c22-84fc-5ddd30168546.description: Earners of the IPWEA Integrating Asset Management and Governance badge have demonstrated a comprehensive understanding of the asset management practice. They are able to explain the importance of taking an integrated approach to asset management within the organisation, and critically evaluate key documents: AM Policy, AM Strategy and AM Plans. They can communicate the importance of having effective AM Enablers that support asset management within an organisation.
07efbd6c-23e4-4c22-84fc-5ddd30168546.name: Integrating Asset Management and Governance

issuer.summary: issued by Institute of Public Works Engineering Australasia (IPWEA)

entity.name: Institute of Public Works Engineering Australasia (IPWEA)

alignments.name: International Infrastructure Management Manual (IIMM)
alignments.description: The International Infrastructure Management Manual (IIMM) has been driven largely by the updates to the ISO 55000 Asset Management Standards. The Manual provides valuable learnings for those who have a vital stewardship role in managing the investment in infrastructure on behalf of their community, customers or investors.

alignments.name: ISO 55000
alignments.description: ISO 55000:2014 provides an overview of asset management, its principles and terminology, and the expected benefits from adopting asset management.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the formal requirements of the course to a satisfactory level.
Successfully completed the formal assessment involving the critical evaluation of an AM Policy, AM Strategy and AM Plans.
Earning the Integrating Asset Management and Governance badge.

e1824821-4972-4c2c-97ca-a4f8c47a9908.description: Earners of the IPWEA Professional Certificate in IFM have a comprehensive knowledge of infrastructure financial management. They understand the role of the Long-Term Financial Plan and the Financial Strategy, recognising infrastructure assets in the preparation of annual financial statements in accordance with international principles. They apply an appropriate approach to the performance measures used for informed decision making and reporting relating to infrastructure finance management.
e1824821-4972-4c2c-97ca-a4f8c47a9908.name: Professional Certificate in Infrastructure Financial Management (IFM)

issuer.summary: issued by Institute of Public Works Engineering Australasia (IPWEA)

entity.name: Institute of Public Works Engineering Australasia (IPWEA)

alignments.name: ISO/TS 55010:2019 Asset Management - Guidance on the alignment and non-financial functions in asset management.
alignments.description: This document gives guidelines for the alignment between financial and non-financial asset management functions, in order to improve internal control as part of an organization's management system.

alignments.name: International Infrastructure Financial Management Manual (IIFMM)
alignments.description: The Manual provides the practical “how to” tools for asset and financial management practitioners to report and manage infrastructure assets in a consistent way, based on the Accounting Standards applicable in various Countries. The Manual is all about getting asset and financial professionals speaking a common language and taking a common approach

alignments.name: International Infrastructure Management Manual (IIMM)
alignments.description: The International Infrastructure Management Manual (IIMM) has been driven largely by the updates to the ISO 55000 Asset Management Standards. The Manual provides valuable learnings for those who have a vital stewardship role in managing the investment in infrastructure on behalf of their community, customers or investors.

alignments.name: International Accounting Standards Board, 2016, IFRS 13, Fair Value Measurement
alignments.description: IFRS 13 defines fair value, sets out a framework for measuring fair value, and requires disclosures about fair value measurements.

alignments.name: International Accounting Standards Board, 2016, IAS 16, Property, Plant and Equipment
alignments.description: IAS 16 establishes principles for recognising property, plant and equipment as assets, measuring their carrying amounts, and measuring the depreciation charges and impairment losses to be recognised in relation to them.

alignments.name: International Accounting Standards Board, 2018, Conceptual Framework for Financial Reporting
alignments.description: The Conceptual Framework sets out the fundamental concepts for financial reporting that guide the Board in developing IFRS Standards. It helps to ensure that the Standards are conceptually consistent and that similar transactions are treated the same way, so as to provide useful information for investors, lenders and other creditors.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the formal requirements of the course to a satisfactory level.
Successfully completed a formal assessment process, containing multiple elements.
Earning the Professional Certificate in Infrastructure Financial Management.

d7b8dfe0-55cd-4f1a-a5d5-24a5e6dd35fc.description: Les titulaires du certificat professionnel en planification de la gestion d’actifs ont une connaissance approfondie de la gestion d’actifs. Ils sont capables d’identifier et d’utiliser les données et de développer un plan de gestion d’actifs complet. Ils peuvent communiquer les impacts des niveaux de service et de risque associés à un budget planifié et à un plan financier à long terme, et élaborer des options de gestion de la demande et des priorités pour les travaux d'immobilisations.
d7b8dfe0-55cd-4f1a-a5d5-24a5e6dd35fc.name: Certificat professionnel en planification de la gestion d’actifs de l’IPWEA et de NAMS Canada

issuer.summary: issued by Institute of Public Works Engineering Australasia (IPWEA)

entity.name: Institute of Public Works Engineering Australasia (IPWEA)

alignments.name: ISO 55000
alignments.description: La norme ISO 55000:2014 donne un aperçu de la gestion d’actifs, de ses principes et de sa terminologie, ainsi que des avantages attendus découlant de son adoption.

alignments.name: International Infrastructure Management Manual (IIMM)
alignments.description: L'IIMM a été largement inspiré par les mises à jour des normes ISO 55000 sur la gestion d’actifs. Le manuel fournit des enseignements précieux pour quiconque joue un rôle essentiel dans la gestion des investissements en infrastructures pour le compte de leur communauté, de leurs clients ou de leurs investisseurs.

badge_template_activities.title: Avoir répondu aux exigences formelles du cours à un niveau satisfaisant.
Avoir réussi une évaluation formelle relative à l'élaboration d'un plan de gestion d'actifs.
Obtenir le certificat professionnel en planification de la gestion d'actifs.
Cette formation est offerte dans le cadre du Programme de gestion des actifs municipaux, administré par la Fédération canadienne des municipalités et financé par le gouvernement du Canada

skills.name: Planification Du Renouvellement De La Gestion D’actifs
Préparation Des Plans De Gestion D’actifs

a0cceabc-5f51-4f68-bf5c-d01c6132aff0.description: Earners of the Project Management Foundations badge understand the language, structure, tools and principles of project management and how to apply them. Earners of this badge have a base understanding of the project lifecycle, from scoping and planning the project, through delivering and monitoring, and closing with finalisation actions and evaluation. Earners have a fundamental knowledge of how to lead projects and deliver.
a0cceabc-5f51-4f68-bf5c-d01c6132aff0.name: Project Management Foundations

issuer.summary: issued by Institute of Public Works Engineering Australasia (IPWEA)

entity.name: Institute of Public Works Engineering Australasia (IPWEA)

alignments.name: PMBOK Guide
alignments.description: A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) is the Project Management Institute’s flagship publication and is a fundamental resource for effective project management in any industry. The book includes The Standard for Project Management.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the formal learning requirements of the course to a satisfactory level.
Successfully complete all assessment items to the required standard.
Earning the Project Management Foundations credential.

5ed872e3-dbcf-4910-805d-7efc74141247.description: Earners of the Stormwater Management Foundations badge have an understanding of stormwater management and best practice stormwater management solutions. Earners of this badge will be able to enhance cross-sectoral and cross-departmental collaboration to deliver better stormwater outcomes for our communities.
5ed872e3-dbcf-4910-805d-7efc74141247.name: Stormwater Management Foundations

Earning the Stormwater Management Foundations credential.

ea5c0f3b-d8da-4027-b498-b29b9f78d391.description: Earners of the Road Engineering badge understand the concepts and principles of the road industry in Australia, including the language used, the people involved and the steps needed to design, build, manage & maintain a road.
ea5c0f3b-d8da-4027-b498-b29b9f78d391.name: Road Engineering

Successfully complete all assessment items to the required standard.
Earning the Roads Engineering credential.

9a4562d6-473f-4df6-92ed-376aa457b295.description: Earners of the Traffic and Transport Foundations badge understand the concepts and principles of optimal transport network planning and traffic management. They have an understanding of road space requirements for general traffic, freight, public transport, cyclists and pedestrians and are able to apply the safe systems approach to user safety and road safety engineering.
9a4562d6-473f-4df6-92ed-376aa457b295.name: Traffic and Transport Foundations

016bc134-f5cc-4afc-95c0-506570790cf1.description: The role of the IPWEA Asset Management Committee is to provide strategic direction and leadership to facilitate an informed debate on policy and education in the asset management discipline as it relates to the public works sector. The strategic priorities of the IPWEA Asset Management Committee are: leadership of the public works / asset management profession, advocacy, support of IPWEA's education strategy, and to advise on policy.
016bc134-f5cc-4afc-95c0-506570790cf1.name: Asset Management Committee Member

issuer.summary: issued by Institute of Public Works Engineering Australasia (IPWEA)

entity.name: Institute of Public Works Engineering Australasia (IPWEA)

badge_template_activities.title: For further information about the IPWEA Asset Management Committee and its members please visit our webpage.

90bcfec8-9833-4d60-b753-af949b5d31e9.description: Earners of the Communications Foundations badge have a sound knowledge of communications fundamentals applied to producing persuasive reports, tailoring written communications to specific audiences, best practice approaches to stakeholder management and effective presentations.
90bcfec8-9833-4d60-b753-af949b5d31e9.name: Communication Foundations

b2bccc32-6aae-4315-b775-3962d4b9db04.description: Earners of the Asset Tracking and Monitoring badge have a sound understanding of Asset Tracking and Monitoring technology, and the myriad use cases it can be applied to. Earners know the components that make up the technology, and are able to assess the technology relative to a specific use case. Earners are also capable of identifying and documenting requirements and are confident to develop a business case and initiate a procurement process to acquire and implement the technology.
b2bccc32-6aae-4315-b775-3962d4b9db04.name: Emerging Technology: Asset Tracking and Monitoring
